verses.verse: Paul, <S%G3972><s%> a prisoner <S%G1198><s%> of Jesus <S%G2424><s%> Christ, <S%G5547><s%> and Timothy <S%G5095><s%> our brother, <S%G80><s%> to Philemon <S%G5371><s%> our dearly beloved, <S%G27><s%> and fellow laborer, <S%G4904><s%>
And to our beloved <S%G27><s%> Apphia, <S%G682><s%> and Archippus <S%G751><s%> our fellow soldier, <S%G4961><s%> and to the church <S%G1577><s%> in your house: <S%G3624><s%>
Grace <S%G5485><s%> to you, and peace, <S%G1515><s%> from God <S%G2316><s%> our Father <S%G3962><s%> and the Lord <S%G2962><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> Christ. <S%G5547><s%>
I thank <S%G2168><s%> my God, <S%G2316><s%> making <S%G4160><s%> mention <S%G3417><s%> of you always <S%G3842><s%> in my prayers, <S%G4335><s%>

Hearing <S%G191><s%> of your love <S%G26><s%> and faith, <S%G4102><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> you have <S%G2192><s%> toward <S%G4314><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> and toward <S%G1519><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> saints; <S%G40><s%>

That the communication <S%G2842><s%> of your faith <S%G4102><s%> may become <S%G1096><s%> effectual <S%G1756><s%> by the acknowledging <S%G1922><s%> of every <S%G3956><s%> good <S%G18><s%> thing which <S%G3588><s%> is in you in Christ <S%G5547><s%> Jesus. <S%G2424><s%>

For we have <S%G2192><s%> great <S%G4183><s%> joy <S%G5485><s%> and consolation <S%G3874><s%> in your love, <S%G26><s%> because <S%G3754><s%> the bowels <S%G4698><s%> of the saints <S%G40><s%> are refreshed <S%G373><s%> by you, brother. <S%G80><s%>
Why, <S%G1352><s%> though I might be much <S%G4183><s%> bold <S%G3954><s%> in Christ <S%G5547><s%> to enjoin <S%G2004><s%> you that which is convenient, <S%G433><s%>

Yet for love's <S%G26><s%> sake I rather <S%G3123><s%> beseech <S%G3870><s%> you, being <S%G5607><s%> such <S%G5108><s%> an one as Paul <S%G3972><s%> the aged, <S%G4246><s%> and now <S%G3570><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> a prisoner <S%G1198><s%> of Jesus <S%G2424><s%> Christ. <S%G5547><s%>
I beseech <S%G3870><s%> you for my son <S%G5043><s%> Onesimus, <S%G3682><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> I have begotten <S%G1080><s%> in my bonds: <S%G1199><s%>
Which <S%G3588><s%> in time <S%G4218><s%> past was to you unprofitable, <S%G890><s%> but now <S%G3570><s%> profitable <S%G2173><s%> to you and to me:
Whom <S%G3739><s%> I have sent <S%G375><s%> again: <S%G375><s%> you therefore receive <S%G4355><s%> him, that is, my <S%G1699><s%> own bowels: <S%G4698><s%>
Whom <S%G3739><s%> I would have retained <S%G2722><s%> with me, that in your stead <S%G5228><s%> he might have ministered <S%G1247><s%> to me in the bonds <S%G1199><s%> of the gospel: <S%G2098><s%>

But without <S%G5565><s%> your mind <S%G1106><s%> would <S%G2309><s%> I do <S%G4160><s%> nothing; <S%G3762><s%> that your benefit <S%G18><s%> should not be as it were of necessity, <S%G318><s%> but willingly. <S%G2596><s%> <S%G1595><s%>
For perhaps <S%G5029><s%> he therefore <S%G1223><s%> <S%G5124><s%> departed <S%G5563><s%> for a season, <S%G5610><s%> that you should receive <S%G568><s%> him for ever; <S%G166><s%>

Not now <S%G3765><s%> as a servant, <S%G1401><s%> but above <S%G5228><s%> a servant, <S%G1401><s%> a brother <S%G80><s%> beloved, <S%G27><s%> specially <S%G3122><s%> to me, but how <S%G4214><s%> much <S%G4214><s%> more <S%G3123><s%> to you, both <S%G2532><s%> in the flesh, <S%G4561><s%> and in the Lord? <S%G2962><s%>
If <S%G1487><s%> you count <S%G2192><s%> me therefore <S%G3767><s%> a partner, <S%G2844><s%> receive <S%G4355><s%> him as myself. <S%G1691><s%>
If <S%G1487><s%> he has wronged <S%G91><s%> you, or <S%G2228><s%> owes <S%G3784><s%> you ought, <S%G5100><s%> put <S%G1677><s%> that on <S%G1677><s%> my <S%G1699><s%> account; <S%G1677><s%>

I Paul <S%G3972><s%> have written <S%G1125><s%> it with my own hand, <S%G5495><s%> I will repay <S%G661><s%> it: albeit <S%G2443><s%> I do not say <S%G3004><s%> to you how <S%G3754><s%> you owe <S%G4359><s%> to me even <S%G2532><s%> your <S%G4572><s%> own <S%G4572><s%> self <S%G4572><s%> besides. <S%G4359><s%>
Yes, <S%G3483><s%> brother, <S%G80><s%> let me have joy <S%G3685><s%> of you in the Lord: <S%G2962><s%> refresh <S%G373><s%> my bowels <S%G4698><s%> in the Lord. <S%G2962><s%>

Having confidence <S%G3982><s%> in your obedience <S%G5218><s%> I wrote <S%G1125><s%> to you, knowing <S%G1492><s%> that you will also <S%G2532><s%> do <S%G4160><s%> more <S%G5228><s%> than <S%G5228><s%> I say. <S%G3004><s%>

But with <S%G260><s%> prepare <S%G2090><s%> me also <S%G2532><s%> a lodging: <S%G3578><s%> for I trust <S%G1679><s%> that through <S%G1223><s%> your <S%G5216><s%> prayers <S%G4335><s%> I shall be given <S%G5483><s%> to you.
There salute <S%G782><s%> you Epaphras, <S%G1889><s%> my fellow prisoner <S%G4869><s%> in Christ <S%G5547><s%> Jesus; <S%G2424><s%>
Marcus, <S%G3138><s%> Aristarchus, <S%G708><s%> Demas, <S%G1214><s%> Lucas, my fellow laborers. <S%G4904><s%>

The grace <S%G5485><s%> of our Lord <S%G2962><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> Christ <S%G5547><s%> be with your <S%G5216><s%> spirit. <S%G4151><s%> Amen. <S%G281><s%> Written from Rome to Philemon, by Onesimus a servant.
